Ah.. I see.
Okay. It looks like they've not built packages for natty in that ppa.  I'm using their unstable PPA with success on my htpc.
how would I get the unstable PPA ?
macer1: The unstable PPA sometimes gives me a package that doesn't work, installing a ppa meant for a different release might give you more serious problems.
remove file that the command you ran created, it should be as simple as: sudo rm /etc/apt/sources.list.d/team-xbmc-*.list
Once you've done that, just run: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:team-xbmc/unstable
after that, you can do apt-get update and follow the rest of the instructions.
